intro: Nonea bourgaei, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for desert gardens and collections. Nonea bourgaei is also valued for its ability to store water, adapting to harsh environmental conditions.
